document.title: Hawaiʻi Common Core Standards for English Language Arts

65ED0474EA0D43319553C7F602A18CF3.description: Acquire and use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal precise actions, emotions, or states of being (e.g., quizzed, whined, stammered) and that are basic to a particular topic (e.g., wildlife, conservation, and endangered when discussing animal preservation).

893567DC10BB4B178FB716F114D079D8.description: Demonstrate understanding of words by relating them to their opposites (antonyms) and to words with similar but not identical meanings (synonyms).

09C3B1B88B7740DEB1A4CCB3DAE74F1E.description: Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.

056788CE104D49DCAEC305CC6760F093.description: Explain the meaning of simple similes and metaphors (e.g., as pretty as a picture) in context.

7442F7E7026B4EA69FDCE52F4AF77AAF.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings:

5E76ABC7F7254A909B1B68671F8EFC2B.description: Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

312CB512BD9646A6BEEDC594F25FE8EC.description: Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., telegraph, photograph, autograph).

2D406A6DE2BB42FE906E46675032F58D.description: Use context (e.g., definitions, examples, or restatements in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

D4EC73F3FEEA47C8819DEB63123EBD76.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing flexibly from a range of strategies:

B5EE235C8ADF45908A7916F1C4DB3596.description: Correctly use frequently confused words (e.g., to, too, two; there, their).

DDBB247995064C959D4407C9094A2FB1.description: Produce complete sentences, recognizing and correcting inappropriate fragments and run-ons.

A40B46B843F94CB8A47CA4ABF9E2B4BA.description: Order adjectives within sentences according to conventional patterns (e.g., a small red bag rather than a red small bag).

1D0C8B562BA749D191F18FEC6E6A9DCA.description: Use modal auxiliaries (e.g., can, may, must) to convey various conditions.

62E51CE526C949E08B021C85CDC87BBE.description: Use the progressive (e.g., I was walking; I am walking; I will be walking) verb tenses.

F67652603A4143B5AE5A7A2714BA3495.description: Use relative pronouns (who, whose, whom, which, that) and relative adverbs (where, when, why).

10F7B09ADC344DCEBA54ED85AB101E03.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English grammar and usage when reading, writing, or speaking:

BC7581F25C044E51B2597697DE12D0F9.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts, demonstrating understanding of audience, task, and purpose, drawing on a full range of linguistic skills.

454BC0337D9D4AE9A2D414663DD6019B.description: Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience in an organized manner, using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details to support main ideas or themes; speak clearly at an understandable pace.

1950FC6FB93B422FA49B0C24DE0DFF10.description: Identify the reasons and evidence a speaker provides to support particular points.

0DC0212E282848DEA5095709689CA61E.description: Paraphrase portions of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

E72E4494E6F0416B99F4B40022AFBEC2.description: Review the key ideas expressed and explain their own ideas and understanding in light of the discussion.

AEBDA0C5A1EB479DBAFE7CADD8B53C36.description: Pose and respond to specific questions to clarify or follow up on information, and make comments that contribute to the discussion and link to the remarks of others.

71EE8599E8B249A8A40EB9C98CAF2A6F.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

4C50021C469248159FB18193A8016A7B.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.

D3613739AB974A36A735E3FB2783B5AF.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacherled) with diverse partners on grade 4 topics and texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly:

402F72F7F3894F83B55C3911F0C94CC5.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

F965204796E649CA95CCD5B4A57995E7.description: Write notes on relevant information collected from experiences and/or print and digital sources, sort into categories, and provide a list of sources.

9DCA97B75AFB4A2191AC043429BF6C41.description: Conduct short research projects that build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic:

84CAD41E73DB4916A9F5CD77F9C68956.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

6B06FAF57BD74E3AB8572067E5BB0207.description: With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to type a minimum of one page in a single sitting.

F1F64A7D4A2142D9BD937186686A9B98.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing. (Editing for conventions should demonstrate command of Writing Foundations and Language standards.)

34A3D02815DF42778A7D5D1F6EFDC0DB.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

CA5ECFCA37644F82908D6B5A44BAAAE7.description: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.

2AD956D0E2BD4719B8A3A07D53916973.description: Use a variety of transitional words and phrases to manage the sequence of events.

2341DB272C4A44B189A0E7AD0A33D74A.description: Use dialogue and description to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations.

51931C9689294FD5BC1825505726FE2C.description: Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally.

4134E702AF754745BF0F1D5E840E9F81.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences:

049BBE39B3874805B08E3F8C63055BF3.description: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information or explanation presented.

FC02520879CD4FEE85592AD5F7CC0284.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

4B301EC879F7418D994E379F8247D18F.description: Link ideas within categories of information using words and phrases (e.g., another, for example, also, because).

658B4022309B41E6BC446B0BB4AC4A8C.description: Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic.

BFC34D37B14B4731A51FB4687A980FBD.description: Introduce a topic clearly and organize related information in paragraphs and sections; include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and multimedia when useful to aid comprehension.

F66DB059A62848FFB9A18B478D015D65.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly:

BB586F7F5484408CB01EF5E402FCAE84.description: Provide a conclusion that follows from the argument presented, as appropriate to the task.

95B7D06B2ADC40EA8E27073BF87CEBC4.description: Link claim and reasons using words and phrases (e.g., for instance, in order to, in addition).

5B939F6DE0AE41F3BD80283D2784A199.description: Provide reasons that are supported by facts and details.

9F0F8DB2A09E417A9762DE07AA481E6A.description: Introduce a topic or text clearly, state a claim, and create an organizational structure in which related ideas are grouped to support the writer’s purpose.

EF1222D4FF1C4745B332A8019A745960.description: Write opinion/argumentative pieces on topics or texts, supporting a claim with reasons and information:

8F3E4CA2133741288374740B534B8B5B.description: Use a comma before a coordinating conjunction in a compound sentence.

79EAED5C0741473184407EE3E2CDCC0E.description: Use commas and quotation marks to mark direct speech and quotations from a text.

42F47B9C605B44BF86159A126F4F1AE3.description: Produce complete sentences, recognizing and correcting inappropriate fragments and run-ons.

6D1111A5EE8D492ABBB53D5AF1CF3873.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English when writing, including multi-paragraph texts:

1004561684DA47529F095EADFE150811.description: Consult reference materials, including dictionaries, as needed to check and correct spellings.

21B6F26FA34A4D43B3BE02F5803EADD8.description: Spell common, grade-appropriate decodable and irregularly-spelled high-frequency words.

7687CC48168B4B0298112522C3CCC343.description: Include the schwa (e.g., active, nation, abandon)

6AD47AEB651344D2BCB3CEC534A98100.description: Include less common prefixes (e.g., fore-, pro-, trans-)

7B69C6E8845046F291A76ADA5A64B2E1.description: Include common Latin roots (e.g., port, form, ject, fer)

AFFDDAB3769B4594B1DE679F7AD01784.description: Spell regular two- and three-syllable words that:

55B75F66DB3E41069760B46BEA075B4B.description: Spell single-syllable words that are homophones

EC269A7B58D14F49B9733F060F174669.description: Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills when encoding words:

B433843177E840EF8D235CAFE2453AA2.description: Legibly and fluently write in manuscript to produce grade-appropriate tasks.

25B032D4E20F46F6B75F9F4AAA6499DE.description: Demonstrate and apply correct handwriting skills:

43E9553161064632B9882F9880BDBCF1.description: Read and comprehend literary texts appropriately complex for grade 4.

E2541C840CA8493BB2223C6B47B4D9D7.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

D9C94DB531A04E0090C17BFC3925138B.description: Compare and contrast the treatment of similar themes and topics (e.g., opposition of good and evil) and patterns of events (e.g., the quest) in stories, myths, and traditional literature from different cultures.

C48197F67AB34046ABEE4BC87297FB60.description: Make connections between the text of a story or drama and a visual or oral presentation of the text, identifying where each version reflects specific descriptions and directions in the text.

E6D3DE67891844E39B2A31B8C289B330.description: Compare and contrast the perspectives from which different stories are narrated, including identifying the point of view of the narrations.

370D8B4DD091417EA7685FC11BC6CFC9.description: Explain major differences between poems, drama, and prose, and refer to the structural elements of poems (e.g., verse, rhythm, meter) and drama (e.g., casts of characters, settings, descriptions, dialogue, stage directions) when writing or speaking about a text.

BBE9B6D14A6F46378F400BE0676B99E5.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including allusions to history, mythology, pop culture, etc. (e.g., Rose is such an Einstein.)

04B677764C81402FAEEC875B46463D6C.description: Drawing on specific details in the text, describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama.

1D64243D7EB845178D407198A5BED472.description: Summarize the text, incorporating a theme determined from details in the text.

62B148CF4D5F47E09B1CE28B9817B476.description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text.

2FC9D632E8EE49448F5C464321A6EAE7.description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

D51AE4035B4C4BEBB9AD7292AC9B04E4.description: Read and comprehend informational texts appropriately complex for grade 4.

B9723F76B7DF4A9394266648DC30CB12.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

DC9F00B62CA54BECA0064BDC50367ADE.description: Integrate information from two texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

B8BA311C941945419A5F0014C72457D9.description: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text.

4A4769BA2574449682FB78814B3935CC.description: Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations, or interactive elements on web pages) and explain how the information contributes to an understanding of the text in which it appears.

6B63B68F8A84494194143451CA4A98FA.description: Compare and contrast a firsthand and secondhand account of the same event or topic; describe the differences in focus and the information provided.

A383A54464744A839586F7DDD6DC9E31.description: Describe the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in a text or part of a text.

C554F12AB3F9481E8E13F1B339456088.description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words or phrases in a text relevant to a grade 4 topic or subject area.

7D7B37E8803A470AAA57D7D7F4F7FE0D.description: Explain events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text, including what happened and why, based on specific information in the text.

8BDFEFB370F64FF7B9A8F9832B2912F5.description: Summarize the text, incorporating an explanation of how the key details support the main/central idea.

BBC28960B4714A5BB4BA7DA02127B5B4.description: Determine the main/central idea of a text and explain how it is supported by key details.

182532390F1E47EDB83D5A52115DB888.description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

A16413DED9CE4620869B04C9F7E4E682.description: Read grade-level text orally with fluency (accuracy, automaticity, and prosody) to support comprehension, in accordance with grade-level fluency norms.

7B7DA0157AF24B15B787605E853EF090.description: Read complex decodable and irregular high frequency words.

1C83632726AA4920A488D8FDD8E72C40.description: Read multisyllabic words in isolation and in text, including:

55BFA88119324AA3ADE7FC02AC72E00A.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to read:
